content: Neel Kashkari Say if JP Morgan issued Contingent Convertible (COCOs) in lieu of raising more capital today? This way, in times of crisis, COCO investors would, by definition, be “converted” to pure equity without regulators or courts. This is not a haircut, per se, since these investors would have agreed to these terms well in advance of the crisis. I know Deutsche makes use of these instruments. I saw your interview on CNBC. Really fascinating stuff. Thanks for explaining your argument more in depth here.
